name: Bengal Tiger
habitat: Forests of India, and Other parts of asia
food: Bengal Tigers are carnivors. They eat small mammals,  pacaderms, and rodents

name: Mantis Shrimp
habitat: Shallow waters of the Indian and Pacific Oceans
food: Manits Shrimp eat different worms and small fish
fun-fact: Mantis shrimps have the most complex eyes in the animal kingdom that can see ultraviolet and polarized light. They have trinocular vision which means that they can see one objects using one of the three different parts of eye.

name: Aye Aye
food: They eat insects fruits and flowers
fun-fact: they can see in the night

name: Ogre Spider
food: they eat bugs and small rodents
fun-fact: they use their web to catch their prey

name: Platypus
habitat: These animals live in autrailian freshwater rivers
food: They scoop up insects and larvae, shellfish, and worms in their bill along with bits of gravel and mud from the bottom
fun-fact: Males are also venomous. They have sharp stingers on the heels of their rear feet and can use them to deliver a strong toxic blow to any foe.

name: Coyote
habitat: They live in cities like Los Angeles, and can be found in most of North America
food: They hunt rodents, fish, frogs, deer, insects, snakes, fruit and even grass
fun-fact: Coyotes are formidable in the field where they enjoy keen vision and a strong sense of smell. They can run up to 40 miles an hour.

name: Axolotl
habitat: A Salamander in found in the ponds and canals of Mexico City
food: They eat mollusks, worms, insect larvae, crustaceans, and some fish.
fun-fact: According to legend, this “water monster” was a god who disguised himself as a salamander to avoid sacrifice.
